channel.title: Reimagining the Internet
channel.description: Reimagining the Internet is a production of the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst, asking scholars, activists, journalists, and artists what is broken on the internet and how to fix it.
channel.author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2020 Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.itunes:title: Reimagining the Internet
channel.itunes:subtitle: An Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure production
channel.itunes:summary: Reimagining the Internet is a production of the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst, asking scholars, activists, journalists, and artists what is broken on the internet and how to fix it.
channel.itunes:author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.googleplay:author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
channel.googleplay:description: Reimagining the Internet is a production of the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst, asking scholars, activists, journalists, and artists what is broken on the internet and how to fix it.

item.title: 01. Welcome to Reimagining the Internet
item.description: Our host Ethan Zuckerman introduces iDPI's new podcast, talking about the need to create online spaces in the public interest instead of a corporate profit motive. Join us as we interview activists, scholars, journalists, and entrepreneurs reimagining the internet as we know it today.
item.dc:creator: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
item.itunes:title: 01. Welcome to Reimagining the Internet
item.itunes:subtitle: Presented by the Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst
item.itunes:summary: Our host Ethan Zuckerman introduces iDPI's new podcast, talking about the need to create online spaces in the public interest instead of a corporate profit motive. Join us as we interview activists, scholars, journalists, and entrepreneurs reimagining the internet as we know it today.
item.itunes:author: Institute for Digital Public Infrastructure
item.googleplay:description: Our host Ethan Zuckerman introduces iDPI's new podcast, talking about the need to create online spaces in the public interest instead of a corporate profit motive. Join us as we interview activists, scholars, journalists, and entrepreneurs reimagining the internet as we know it today.

item.title: 02. Talia Stroud, Civic Signals
item.description: Talia Stroud from the University of Texas joins us to talk about her project Civic Signals, a project reimagining the Internet as a public space. She walks us through what’s wrong with the type of speech currently rewarded by Facebook and Twitter, and what it might look like to promote civic speech instead. Recorded August, 2020. Visit our episode web page for links to Civic Signals' website and newsletter, and Eli Pariser's TED Talk.
